A2JInterviewVersion.name: A2JInterviewVersion
A2JInterviewVersion.comment: Static version number to be used by client reader.

1-Introduction.name: 1-Introduction
1-Introduction.text:
Welcome to the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program (VLP) online interview. This interview will let you apply for help from the VLP.

You will be asked to provide details on your household finances during this interview. Please make sure you have information about income and expenses for all members of your household before you begin.

You must fill in the items with red labels to continue to the next screen.

Click 'Begin' to start.
1-Introduction.learn: What does the "Learn More" button do?
1-Introduction.help: Please click on the 'Learn More' button throughout the interview if you need help.
1-Introduction.codeAfter:
SET [Total income NU] TO 0
SET A2JInterviewVersion TO "2010-09-28"

1-Disclaimer.name: 1-Disclaimer
1-Disclaimer.text:
Completing this interview does not mean that the Volunteer Lawyers Program has accepted your case. VLP cannot represent everyone who applies for help. VLP cases must meet certain established guidelines.

Click 'Yes' if you understand this and want to apply. Click 'No' if you do not agree.

2-Name and gender.text: Please tell me your name and gender.

3-Race.help: The Mobile Volunteer Lawyers Program does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, age, or religion. This question is only for statistical purposes.

4-Marketing.name: 4-Marketing
4-Marketing.text: How did you hear about the Mobile Volunteer Lawyers Program?
4-Marketing.help: We want to know how people find out about our services. If you were told by a friend, put that here. If you searched online, at www.google.com for example, put in what you searched for and where. We want as many people as possible to know about our services.

5 Advance Directive Dq1.name: 5 Advance Directive Dq1
5 Advance Directive Dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this matter. The person signing the advance directive must apply for assistance. Please ask that person to fill out an application.

6 Advance Directive Dq2.name: 6 Advance Directive Dq2
6 Advance Directive Dq2.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with an advance directive unless you are over the age of 19. You can contact the Mobile Bar Association's Lawyer Referral Service online at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

7 CustodyChange dq1.name: 7 CustodyChange dq1
7 CustodyChange dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Volunteer Lawyers Program is not able to help with your particular legal issue. If the child does not live in Mobile County or there is a dispute over custody, please contact the Lawyer Referral Service at (251) 433-1032. If the parents were not married, please contact Strickland Youth Center at (251) 574-1450 or (251) 574- 5257 for assistance.

8 ChildSupport dq1.name: 8 ChildSupport dq1
8 ChildSupport dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

9 ChildSupport dq2.name: 9 ChildSupport dq2
9 ChildSupport dq2.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help with your particular issue. Please contact the Alabama Department of Human Resources at (251) 415-3554.

10 ChildSupport dq3.name: 10 ChildSupport dq3
10 ChildSupport dq3.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help with your particular issue. DHR allows a request for increase in child support payments every three years.

11 Collections dq1.name: 11 Collections dq1
11 Collections dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program is not able to help with your particular legal issue. Please contact the Small Claims Court at (251) 574-8517 or online at http://13jc.alacourt.gov/clerkDistrictCivil.html for information regarding collection by garnishment or execution.
11 Collections dq1.learn: What if I need help with the forms?
11 Collections dq1.help: If you have received a pamphlet from Small Claims Court and need assistance with the forms, please call our office at (251) 438-1102.

12 Collections dq2.name: 12 Collections dq2
12 Collections dq2.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

13 Collections dq3.name: 13 Collections dq3
13 Collections dq3.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Volunteer Lawyers Program is not able to help with your particular legal issue. You may contact Legal Services Alabama by telephone at (866) 456-4995 or online at http://www.legalservicesalabama.org for possible assistance with your legal issue.

14 Collections dq4.name: 14 Collections dq4
14 Collections dq4.text: The Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program is not able to help with your particular issue unless you have contacted Consumer Credit Counseling Services for possible assistance. Please contact Consumer Credit Counseling Services at (251) 602-0011 in Mobile or (251) 679-9600 in Saraland.

15 Contracts dq1.name: 15 Contracts dq1
15 Contracts dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

16 Estates dq1.name: 16 Estates dq1
16 Estates dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

17 Estates dq2.name: 17 Estates dq2
17 Estates dq2.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. The person living in the home must be the Volunteer Lawyers Program client.

18 GC dq1.name: 18 GC dq1
18 GC dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

19 GC dq2.name: 19 GC dq2
19 GC dq2.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. You must live in Mobile County to become the conservator of the estate of a Mobile County resident. You can contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service online at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

20 GC dq3.name: 20 GC dq3
20 GC dq3.text: Unfortunately the Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. If you want to establish a permanent relationship, please see the Custody section.

21 Homeownership dq1.name: 21 Homeownership dq1
21 Homeownership dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

22 LLT dq1.name: 22 LLT dq1
22 LLT dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. You can contact Legal Services Alabama at (877) 393-2333 or the Mobile Housing Board at (251) 434-2212 for possible assistance.

23 LLT dq2.name: 23 LLT dq2
23 LLT dq2.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. You can contact Legal Services Alabama at (877) 393-2333 for possible assistance.

24 LLT dq3.name: 24 LLT dq3
24 LLT dq3.text: The Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. Please contact Legal Services Alabama immediately at (251) 433-6560.

25 LLT dq4.name: 25 LLT dq4
25 LLT dq4.text: Unfortunately the Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. You can contact Legal Services Alabama at (877) 393-2333 for possible assistance. A booklet regarding your legal rights as a tenant is available at the VLP office (107 St. Francis Street, Suite 1806) or online at http://www.arisecitizens.org (scroll down to "Landlord Tenant Handbook"). You also can contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service online at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032.

26 LLT dq5.name: 26 LLT dq5
26 LLT dq5.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile County Health Department at (251) 690-8158 for possible assistance.

27 NameChange dq1.name: 27 NameChange dq1
27 NameChange dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

28 Paternity dq1.name: 28 Paternity dq1
28 Paternity dq1.text: Unfortunately the Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with this matter. Please contact the Department of Human Resources' (DHR) Investigation and Recovery program at (251) 574-8465. You also can find information on establishing paternity at http://www.alabamalegalhelp.org. You can also contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at (251) 433-1032.

29 Paternity dq2.name: 29 Paternity dq2
29 Paternity dq2.text: All parties involved in paternity cases must be willing to sign paperwork regarding this matter. If all parties agree, please contact the Volunteer Lawyers Office at (251) 438-1102 for further information.

30 Paternity dq3.name: 30 Paternity dq3
30 Paternity dq3.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

31 POA dq1.name: 31 POA dq1
31 POA dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. The Volunteer Lawyers Program can help only if the person who wants to assign Power of Attorney applies for assistance. You can ask that person to fill out an application or you can contact the Mobile Bar Association's Lawyer Referral Service online at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

32 POA dq2.name: 32 POA dq2
32 POA dq2.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

33 Uncont Div dq1.name: 33 Uncont Div dq1
33 Uncont Div dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program is not able to help with your particular legal issue. Please contact Legal Services Alabama at (251) 433-6560 for possible assistance. You also can contact the Penelope House 24-hour Family Violence Center 24-hour Crisis Hotline at (251) 342-8994 or the Alabama Domestic Violence Hotline at (800) 650-6522.

34 Uncont Div dq2.name: 34 Uncont Div dq2
34 Uncont Div dq2.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

35 Visitation dq1.name: 35 Visitation dq1
35 Visitation dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. You can contact Strickland Youth Services at (251) 574-1450 for information on setting or enforcing visitation. You can find more information on setting visitation, changing a visitation order, or requesting a contempt hearing at http://www.alabamalegalhelp.org.

36 WageClaim dq1.name: 36 WageClaim dq1
36 WageClaim dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this issue. You can contact Legal Services Alabama toll-free at 1 (877) 393-2333 or the Mobile Bar Association's Lawyer Referral Service online at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

37 Will dq1.name: 37 Will dq1
37 Will dq1.text: Unfortunately the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this matter. The person signing the will must apply for assistance. Please ask that person to fill out an application.

38 Will dq2.name: 38 Will dq2
38 Will dq2.text: Unfortunately the Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot assist you with this issue. Please contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Service at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

39 WC dq1.name: 39 WC dq1
39 WC dq1.text: Unfortunately the Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you file a Workman's Comp claim. VLP only can assist if you have settled the claim, left open the medical payments portion, and are having problems getting medical payments or authorization for treatments and/or medications. If you need help evaluating or filing a claim, you can contact Mobile Bar Association's Lawyer Referral Service online at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

40 WC dq2.name: 40 WC dq2
40 WC dq2.text: Unfortunately the Volunteer Lawyers Program cannot help you with this matter. You may contact the Legal Services office in the county where your case was settled or you can contact Mobile Bar Association's Lawyer Referral Service online at http://www.mobilebar.com/ or by telephone at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance.

6-2_5_Disqualification.name: 6-2_5_Disqualification

For 24 hour crisis assistance, you can call the Penelope House Crisis line at (251) 342-8994 or the Alabama Domestic Violence Hotline at (800) 650-6522.

83-Client Disclaimer.name: 83-Client Disclaimer
83-Client Disclaimer.text: In submitting this application, I hereby authorize the Mobile Bar Association Volunteer Lawyers program (hereinafter the VLP), to review this application for possible referral to a volunteer private attorney. I understand that my application has not been accepted at this time. I understand that I do not yet have an attorney through the VLP and further that the VLP cannot guarantee me representation in this matter. I understand that the VLP is not required to provide me an attorney and can only attempt to find a volunteer attorney for me.

84-Client Disclaimer 2.name: 84-Client Disclaimer 2
84-Client Disclaimer 2.text: I understand that if a volunteer attorney agrees to represent me, the volunteer attorney will do so without charge for his/her services. I understand and agree that I am responsible for paying all fees and expenses (such as court costs and publication expenses) associated with my case.

85-Client Disclaimer 3.name: 85-Client Disclaimer 3
85-Client Disclaimer 3.text:
No further action regarding this application is required of me at this time. I understand that the VLP will contact me after my application has been reviewed.

If you do not agree to these terms, the VLP cannot accept your application for review. You may contact the Mobile Bar Association Lawyer Referral Program at (251) 433-1032 for possible assistance with your legal matter.
